intro: Helichrysum chionoides, commonly known as the silver leaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish to golden-orange flowers that are often arranged in dense, spherical clusters. The plant has silver-gray leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Helichrysum chionoides is also known for its long-lasting flowers, which retain their color when dried, making it popular in floral arrangements.
